articles.author: Jon Henley
articles.title: Hunger stones, wrecks and bones: Europe's drought brings past to surface - The Guardian
articles.description: Receding rivers and lakes have exposed ghost villages, a Nazi vehicle and a Roman fort
articles.content: The warning could not be starker. Wenn du mich siehst, dann weine (If you see me, then weep), reads the grim inscription on a rock in the Elbe River near the northern Czech town of Dín, close to the … [+5511 chars]
